metadata.title: MeeMaw's Recipe Collection
metadata.note: Recipes restored to original ingredients (butter, eggs, whole milk) and categories consolidated.

recipes.name: Marinated Peppers
ingredients: to taste Freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350–375°F (175–190°C). Line a baking sheet with foil for easier cleanup.
Place the whole red peppers on the baking sheet. Roast for 30–40 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins are blistered and the peppers are very soft.

While the peppers roast, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, sugar, dried basil, and a few grinds of black pepper in a small bowl. If using capers, you can stir them into the marinade now.
When the peppers are done, transfer them to a bowl and cover tightly (or place them in a paper bag) for 10–15 minutes to steam. This loosens the skins.
Peel off the skins, remove stems and seeds, and cut the pepper flesh into strips.
Combine the warm pepper strips with the marinade (and capers, if using). Toss gently until everything is well coated.
Let the peppers cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor.
Serve at cool room temperature as an appetizer, side dish, or part of an antipasto platter.

recipes.name: Mushroom and Nut Pate
ingredients: dash, or to taste Tabasco or hot sauce
instructions: Melt the unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium heat.

Add the sliced mushrooms, chopped onion, and minced garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8–10 minutes, until the mushrooms release their liquid and it has evaporated, and the vegetables are soft and lightly browned. Let cool slightly.
In a food processor or blender, coarsely chop the slivered almonds. Remove 2–3 tablespoons and reserve for garnish, if desired.
With the processor running, slowly drizzle in the vegetable oil and process until the almonds form a thick, spreadable paste.

Add the cooked mushroom mixture, dried oregano, dried thyme, and a dash of hot sauce to the processor. Blend until the mixture is fairly smooth but still has a little texture, scraping down the sides as needed.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional hot sauce and a pinch of salt, if desired.
Transfer the pâté to a small bowl or crock. Smooth the top and sprinkle with the reserved chopped almonds and a little chopped parsley or sesame seeds, if you like.
Cover and chill for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to blend. Serve cold or cool with crackers, sliced baguette, or raw vegetables.

recipes.name: The Little English Muffin Pizza
ingredients: 4 halves English muffins (2 whole muffins, split)
about 1–2 tablespoons per muffin half Pizza sauce
about 2–3 tablespoons per muffin half Mozzarella cheese, grated
about 1 tablespoon per muffin half Bacon bits
instructions: Preheat the oven or toaster oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange the English muffin halves, cut side up, on a baking sheet.
Spread each muffin half with 1–2 tablespoons of pizza sauce.
Top each with 2–3 tablespoons of grated mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with bacon bits.
Bake for about 8–10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the muffin edges are lightly crisp.
Serve hot. Makes 4 small pizzas.

recipes.name: Roasted Nuts
ingredients: 4 cups Mixed nuts (unsalted, any combination of pecans, walnuts, almonds, cashews, etc.)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easier cleanup.
Place the nuts in a large bowl. Drizzle with the melted unsalted butter or butter and sprinkle with salt if using.
Toss until all the nuts are evenly coated.
Spread the nuts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 30–40 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes, until the nuts are fragrant and lightly toasted. Watch carefully so they do not burn.
Remove from the oven and let cool completely on the pan; they will crisp as they cool.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1–2 weeks.

recipes.name: Cheese Dip (Like Mexico Chiquito's)
ingredients: 1/2 pepper Pickled jalapeno pepper (minced, or to taste)
instructions: Melt the unsalted butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat.
Stir in the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1–2 minutes to make a roux (do not let it brown).
Add the paprika, dry mustard, cumin, ketchup, chili powder, and jalapeno juice. Stir well.
Gradually pour in the milk, whisking constantly to avoid lumps. Increase heat slightly and cook, stirring, until the mixture thickens and comes to a gentle simmer.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in the minced jalapeno, garlic powder, and grated cheese. Continue stirring until the cheese melts and the dip is smooth.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more jalapeno or chili powder for extra heat if desired.
Serve warm with tortilla chips, vegetables, or as a topping for nachos.

recipes.name: Chocolate Fondue
ingredients: as desired Assorted dippers (such as pound cake cubes, cookies, marshmallows, fresh strawberries, pineapple chunks, mandarin orange segments, cherries)
instructions: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat.
Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the cocoa powder until smooth.
Stir in the sugar and evaporated milk, mixing until well combined.
Return the pan to low heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is smooth, hot, and slightly thickened. Do not let it boil.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Transfer the fondue to a fondue pot or small slow cooker to keep warm, or serve immediately in a bowl.
Arrange your choice of dippers on a platter and enjoy!

recipes.name: Crab Dip
ingredients: 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt or sour cream
1/4 teaspoon Hot pepper sauce (or to taste)
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the yogurt, mayonnaise, and softened cream cheese. Stir or beat until smooth.
Add the horseradish, dry mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce. Mix well.
Fold in the shredded cheddar cheese and flaked crab meat until evenly distributed.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let the flavors blend.
Before serving, sprinkle the top with paprika for color.
Serve chilled with crackers, toasted baguette slices, breadsticks, or fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Confectioner's Glaze
recipes.servings: About 2 cups (enough for cookies, cakes, or sweet rolls)
ingredients: 1 pound (about 3 3/4 cups) Powdered sugar (sifted if lumpy)
2-4 tablespoons Hot water (start with 2, add more as needed)
2 teaspoons Extract (vanilla, rum, maple, lemon, or any flavor)
instructions: In a medium bowl, sift the powdered sugar if it is at all lumpy.
In a small bowl or cup, combine 2 tablespoons hot water with the extract of your choice.
Add the liquid to the powdered sugar and stir with a spoon until smooth.
Add more hot water, 1 teaspoon at a time, stirring well after each addition, until the glaze reaches your desired consistency. For a thin drizzle, make it thinner; for spreading, keep it thicker.
Use immediately to glaze cookies, cakes, or sweet rolls. The glaze will set as it cools.

recipes.name: Fluffy Cocoa Frosting
recipes.servings: Enough to frost a 2-layer 9-inch or 10-inch cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup Buttermilk or evaporated whole milk (more if needed)
instructions: Sift together the cocoa powder and powdered sugar into a mixing bowl.
Add the vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and 1/2 cup of buttermilk or evaporated milk.
Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth and fluffy, about 2 minutes.
If the frosting is too thick, add additional buttermilk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches a good spreading consistency.
Use immediately to frost cooled cakes or cupcakes. The frosting will set slightly as it stands.

recipes.name: Fluffy White Frosting
instructions: Fill the bottom of a double boiler with water and bring to a rapid boil over high heat.
In the top of the double boiler (off heat), combine the egg whites, sugar, corn syrup, water, cream of tartar, and salt.
Place the top pan over the boiling water and immediately begin beating with a handheld electric mixer at high speed.
Continue beating constantly for about 7 minutes, or until the frosting forms stiff, glossy peaks.
Remove from heat, add the vanilla extract, and beat for another minute until the vanilla is fully incorporated and the frosting is very fluffy.
Use immediately to frost a cooled cake, spreading with a spatula to create swirls and peaks. The frosting will set as it cools.

recipes.name: Orange-Cream Cheese Frosting
ingredients: 8 oz Light cream cheese (softened to room temperature)
1 teaspoon, finely grated Fresh orange zest (from about 1/2 orange)
instructions: Place the cottage cheese in a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process for about 1 minute, or until completely smooth with no lumps.
Add the softened cream cheese, vanilla extract, and orange zest. Process until well combined and very smooth, about 30 seconds.
Add the sifted powdered sugar. Pulse 3-5 times, then process briefly until the frosting is smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetness if desired by adding a bit more powdered sugar.
Use immediately to frost a cooled carrot cake, spice cake, or other baked goods. Store any leftover frosting covered in the refrigerator.

recipes.name: Cocktail Sauce
ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoons Fresh lemon juice (optional, but recommended)
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the catsup, chili sauce, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, hot sauce, and celery salt.
Stir well until fully mixed.
Add the lemon juice if using, and stir again.
Taste and adjust the horseradish and hot sauce to your preferred level of heat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
Serve chilled with boiled shrimp, crab, or oysters. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

recipes.name: Tomato Sauce
recipes.servings: About 4 cups (enough for pasta or stuffed shells)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Olive oil or vegetable oil
1/2 teaspoon Dried basil or Italian seasoning (optional)
instructions: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook, stirring frequently, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more, stirring constantly so it doesn't burn.
Stir in the tomato juice, tomato paste, chili sauce, salt, sugar, and pepper. Add dried basil or Italian seasoning if using.
Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce heat to low.
Simmer uncovered for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the flavors have blended.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Use as a sauce for pasta, stuffed shells, lasagna, or pizza.

recipes.name: Bechamel Sauce Topping
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon White pepper (freshly ground, or to taste)
pinch Ground nutmeg (optional, for classic French flavor)
instructions: In a medium saucepan, melt the unsalted butter or butter over medium heat.
Add the flour and whisk constantly for 2-3 minutes to cook the flour and form a smooth roux. The mixture should be bubbly but not browned.
Gradually pour in the warm milk, whisking constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer, whisking frequently. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce thickens to a creamy consistency that coats the back of a spoon.
Season with salt, white pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg if desired. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Use immediately as a topping for steamed vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, or asparagus), as a base for creamy pasta dishes, in casseroles, or as a component in lasagna or gratins.
If the sauce becomes too thick, thin it with a little more warm milk. If it's too thin, simmer a bit longer or whisk in a small amount of flour paste (1 tsp flour mixed with 1 tbsp water).
Store leftover sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat gently, whisking in a little milk to restore smoothness.

recipes.name: Meringue
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Prepare a fully baked pie with cooled filling.
In a clean, grease-free bowl, beat egg whites on medium speed until frothy.
Add cream of tartar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly, until stiff, glossy peaks form and all sugar is dissolved.
Pile the meringue lightly over the cooled filling, spreading to seal completely to the crust edge to prevent shrinking.
Swirl the surface or pull up points with the back of a spoon for a decorative finish.
Bake 15–20 minutes, until the meringue is set and lightly golden.
Cool at room temperature, away from drafts, before serving.

recipes.name: Blueberry Pie Filling
ingredients: 3 tbsp (fresh berries) or 5 tbsp (frozen berries) Cornstarch
2–3 tablespoons Cream cheese (softened, to line crust)
As desired Light whipped topping (for serving)
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup (150 g) of the blueberries with the water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook a few minutes until the berries begin to soften.
Strain the mixture to remove the berry skins, returning the liquid to the saucepan.
Whisk the cornstarch into a small amount of cool water to make a smooth slurry, then whisk into the hot blueberry liquid.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a full boil and thickens and becomes glossy.
Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice, then gently fold in the remaining blueberries.
Let the filling cool until just warm.
Spread a thin layer of softened cream cheese over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Pour the blueberry filling into the shell and smooth the top. Chill until fully set.
Before serving, spread or dollop light whipped topping over the pie if desired.

recipes.name: Cherry Pie Filling (Quick)
ingredients: 1 can (16 oz), drained (reserve juice) Water-packed red sour cherries
As needed Water (to bring reserved juice to 1 cup / 240 ml)
1 ounce cream cheese (softened, to line crust)
instructions: Drain the canned cherries and reserve the juice. Add enough water to the juice to make 1 cup (240 ml).
In a medium saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Gradually whisk in the cherry juice mixture until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and comes to a full boil.
Remove from the heat and stir in almond extract, grated orange rind, and the drained cherries.
Let the cherry mixture cool until just warm.
Spread the softened cream cheese in a thin layer over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Pour the cherry filling into the crust and smooth the top. Chill until fully set.
Before serving, spread or dollop light whipped topping over the pie.

recipes.name: Karo Nut Pie
ingredients: 1 Unbaked pie shell (9-inch, homemade or purchased)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Place a baking sheet on the center rack to catch any drips.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together Karo syrup, sugar, melted unsalted butter or butter, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
Stir in the pecan pieces until evenly distributed.
Pour the filling into the unbaked 9-inch pie shell.
Bake 35–45 minutes, until the center is just set and only slightly jiggles when gently shaken. If the crust browns too quickly, cover the edge with foil.
Cool completely on a rack before slicing.
notes: Wilfred Carle's favorite pie to eat!

recipes.name: Peanut Butter Pie
ingredients: 6 tablespoons Sugar (or use Meringue recipe in this section)
instructions: Prepare the crumb layer by mixing powdered sugar and crunchy peanut butter with a fork until crumbly. Reserve about 1/4 of the mixture for topping and press the remaining 3/4 evenly into the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
In a heavy saucepan, whisk together sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
Gradually whisk in the hot scalded milk until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat egg yolks with the softened unsalted butter.
Slowly whisk a ladleful of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture to temper, then return the egg mixture to the saucepan.
Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until the custard thickens and just begins to bubble. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
Pour the hot custard into the prepared pie shell over the peanut butter crumbs.
Prepare a meringue with the 3 egg whites and sugar (or use the Meringue recipe in this section). Spread the meringue over the hot filling, sealing to the crust.
Sprinkle the reserved peanut butter crumb mixture over the meringue.
Bake at 325–350°F (165–175°C) until the meringue is golden brown. Cool completely before serving.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (12 oz can), undiluted Evaporated whole milk
1 Unbaked pie shell (9-inch, with high fluted edge)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place a baking sheet on the middle rack.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs until blended.
Add pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves. Whisk until smooth.
Gradually whisk in the evaporated milk until the filling is well combined.
Place the unbaked 9-inch pie shell on the hot baking sheet. Pour the filling into the shell.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 15 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and continue baking 35–45 minutes, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean or the center registers about 190°F (88°C).
Cool on a wire rack. Chill if you like a firmer texture.
Top with whipped topping before serving, if desired.

recipes.name: Strawberry Glaze Pie (French)
ingredients: 1 quart Fresh strawberries (washed, hulled, well drained)
As needed Water (to bring berry juice to 1 1/2 cups / 360 ml)
instructions: Reserve the nicest half of the strawberries to remain whole. Slice them in half if large.
Mash the remaining berries and strain through a sieve to extract juice. Add enough water to make 1 1/2 cups (360 ml) of liquid.
In a saucepan, whisk together sugar and cornstarch.
Gradually whisk in the strawberry juice mixture until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens and turns glossy.
Remove from heat and let cool until just warm.
Spread softened cream cheese in a thin layer over the bottom of a cooled, baked 9-inch pie shell.
Arrange the reserved whole strawberries over the cream cheese, cut side down if halved.
Pour the warm glaze evenly over the berries, coating them well.
Chill for at least 2 hours, until set.
Remove from the refrigerator about 20 minutes before serving to take the chill off the crust. Top with whipped topping, if desired.

recipes.name: Baked Rice Custard
ingredients: 1 1/3 cups Milk (scalded (heated until steaming with a film on top))
1 cup Cooked white rice (medium-grain rice, cooked and cooled)
1/2 teaspoon Ground cinnamon (plus extra for dusting)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Lightly coat four custard cups or a 1-quart baking dish with nonstick spray.
In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar, vanilla, and salt until well combined.
Heat the milk in a saucepan or microwave until it is scalded (steaming hot with a film on top, but not boiling). This takes about 3-4 minutes in the microwave or 5 minutes on the stovetop.
Slowly pour the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from cooking.
Stir in the cooked rice, raisins, and cinnamon until evenly distributed.
Divide the mixture evenly among the four custard cups, or pour it all into a baking dish.
Place the cups or dish in a larger baking pan. Carefully pour hot water into the pan to reach about 1 inch up the sides of the custard cups (this is a water bath, or bain-marie).
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean and the custard is just set.
Carefully remove from the water bath and let cool slightly.
Serve warm or chilled, dusted with a little extra cinnamon if desired.

recipes.name: Bread Pudding
ingredients: 7 slices Good quality white bread (French, Italian, or artisan-style)
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick spray.
Spread a generous amount of unsalted butter or butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Arrange the bread slices, buttered side up, in the bottom and slightly up the sides of the prepared baking dish, overlapping as needed.
In a large bowl, whisk together the milk, beaten eggs, sugar, salt, raisins, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg (if using) until well combined.
Pour the milk mixture evenly over the bread in the baking dish.
If you have extra bread slices, tear them into pieces and place them on top, pressing down gently so they are submerged in the custard.
Let the pudding stand for about 10 minutes to allow the bread to soak up some of the liquid. If your bread is very dry or stale, let it stand a bit longer.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the pudding is set in the center and the top is golden brown.
For an extra-crispy top, place the pudding under a hot broiler for 2-3 minutes, watching carefully to prevent burning.
Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm, plain or with a drizzle of cream, caramel sauce, or a dusting of powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Cranberry or Blueberry Crunch
ingredients: 3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) Butter (cold, cut into small pieces)
1/2 lb (about 2 cups) Fresh cranberries or blueberries
instructions: First, make the berry sauce: In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water. Stir to dissolve the sugar, then bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 5 minutes.

Add the fresh cranberries or blueberries and cook, stirring occasionally, until the berry skins pop and the mixture thickens, about 15 minutes. To test for doneness, drop a spoonful onto a cold plate—it should jell slightly.
Remove from heat and let the sauce cool slightly. You can use it warm or refrigerate until ready to use.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 9-inch pie pan or similar baking dish with nonstick spray.

For the crumb mixture: In a medium bowl, combine the oats, 3/4 cup sugar, flour, and salt. Add the cold unsalted butter or butter and work it in with your fingers or a pastry cutter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press half of the crumb mixture gently and evenly into the bottom of the prepared baking dish to form a crust.
Spread 1 1/2 cups of the prepared berry sauce over the crust, leaving a small border around the edge so the filling doesn't spread to the very edge.
Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture evenly over the top of the berry filling, patting it down gently. Press the edges to seal.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbling around the edges.
Let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature, plain or with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

recipes.name: Kitchen Memorandum
instructions: BAKING TIPS:
- Always preheat your oven 10-15 minutes before baking
- Measure dry ingredients by spooning into measuring cups and leveling off
- Measure liquids in clear measuring cups at eye level
- Test baking powder/soda freshness: add to hot water; should bubble vigorously
- Bring butter and eggs to room temperature for better incorporation (about 30 minutes)
MIXING GUIDELINES:
- Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy (3-5 minutes)
- Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
- Alternate adding dry and wet ingredients, beginning and ending with dry
- Don't overmix once flour is added - mix just until no streaks remain
PAN PREPARATION:
- Grease pans with shortening, butter, or nonstick spray
- For cakes, grease and flour pans, or line with parchment
- For cookies, parchment paper prevents sticking and ensures even browning
STORAGE:
- Cool baked goods completely before storing
- Store cookies in airtight containers with parchment between layers
- Most cookie dough can be refrigerated 3 days or frozen 3 months
- Bread stays fresh longer stored in paper bags, not plastic
These tips from Alma's kitchen will help ensure success with all recipes in this collection.

recipes.name: Turkey Sausage
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups Wheat germ (adds body and a nutty flavor)
1/2 teaspoon Red pepper flakes or ground red pepper (or to taste)
instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the wheat germ and vegetable oil until evenly moistened. Cover and let stand at room temperature overnight, or at least 1 hour.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground turkey, sage, coriander, black and white pepper, red pepper, cumin, thyme, garlic, Old Bay, and salt.

Add the wheat germ mixture and mix thoroughly with clean hands until the seasonings are evenly distributed and the mixture feels cohesive but not dry. If it seems crumbly, sprinkle in 2–4 tablespoons (30–60 ml) cold water and mix again.
For best flavor, cover and refrigerate the sausage mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Shape into patties or logs for links, using about 1/4 cup (60 g) of mixture per patty.

To cook, brown sausage over medium heat in a lightly oiled skillet, 4–5 minutes per side, until cooked through (internal temperature 165°F / 74°C). Alternatively, shape into logs and bake on a parchment-lined tray at 375°F (190°C) for 18–22 minutes, turning once.
Serve hot with eggs and potatoes, or cool and freeze cooked patties for quick breakfasts.

recipes.name: Pizza (Carle Version)
ingredients: 1 package (about 6.5 oz / 185 g) Pizza crust mix (or equivalent homemade dough for one 12–14 inch pan)
as needed Nonstick vegetable cooking spray
1–1 1/2 cups Pizza sauce (such as Ragu Pizza natural sauce)
1/2–1 cup, cut in strips Ham or turkey ham
2–3 cups, grated or sliced Mozzarella cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Prepare the pizza crust dough according to package or recipe directions.
Spray a round or rectangular pizza pan with nonstick cooking spray and sprinkle with 1–2 tablespoons (10–20 g) cornmeal.
Place the dough in the center of the pan. With damp fingertips, gently press and stretch the dough out to the edges, keeping the thickness even.
Par-bake the crust for 8–10 minutes, until just set and lightly golden at the edges.
Remove from the oven and spread 1–1 1/2 cups (240–360 ml) pizza sauce over the crust, leaving a small border.
Distribute sliced onion, olives, mushrooms, bell pepper, and ham or turkey ham evenly over the sauce.
Return the pizza to the oven and bake for 10–15 minutes, until the toppings are hot and the crust is golden.
Remove from the oven, top generously with grated or sliced Mozzarella cheese, and bake 5–8 minutes more, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Cool a few minutes, then cut into wedges or squares and serve.

recipes.name: Fettuccine Primavera
ingredients: 1 package (8 oz), cubed Light neufchatel cheese
1 cup, cubed Cooked smoked turkey breast
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add fettuccine and cook according to package directions.
During the last 5 minutes of pasta cooking time, add the broccoli florets and carrot slices to the boiling water with the pasta.
While the pasta cooks, combine the milk, neufchatel cheese, green onion, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder in a medium saucepan.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce is smooth and slightly thickened.
Stir the smoked turkey and Parmesan cheese into the sauce and heat gently until warmed through. Do not boil.
Drain the pasta and vegetables well and return them to the pot or a large serving bowl.
Pour the hot sauce over the pasta and vegetables and toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately, with extra Parmesan at the table if desired.

recipes.name: Baked Lasagna Casserole
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Olive oil or vegetable oil
3/4 pound (about 1 1/2 cups) Ricotta cheese or cottage cheese
3/4 pound, sliced or shredded Mozzarella cheese
instructions: Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain, rinse with cool water, and lay flat on a towel to prevent sticking.

Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large heavy skillet or saucepan over medium heat. Add the ground beef, onion, garlic, and parsley. Cook, breaking up the meat with a spoon, until the beef is browned and the onion is tender.
Stir in the tomato paste, water, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. The sauce should thicken.
In a medium bowl, beat the eggs lightly, then stir in the ricotta or cottage cheese until well combined.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly coat a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.
Spread about 1/2 cup of the meat sauce over the bottom of the prepared dish.
Layer 4 lasagna noodles over the sauce, overlapping slightly. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles, then add a third of the remaining sauce, and a third of the mozzarella.
Repeat the layers: noodles, remaining ricotta mixture, half of the remaining sauce, and half of the remaining mozzarella.
Top with the remaining noodles, the rest of the sauce, the rest of the mozzarella, and sprinkle generously with Parmesan cheese.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and lightly golden.
Let the lasagna stand for 10-15 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

recipes.name: Tofu-Cheese Stuffed Shells
ingredients: 1 can (14.5 oz), undrained Canned diced tomatoes
instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package directions until al dente. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside on a towel.
In a small saucepan, cook the shredded carrot and green onion in 2-3 tablespoons of water until tender, about 3-4 minutes. Drain well.
In a medium bowl, mash the tofu with a fork until crumbly.
Add the cooked carrot and green onion, ricotta, cheddar, 1/4 cup of the mozzarella, beaten egg white, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
In a medium saucepan, combine the undrained diced tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, sugar, garlic powder, and fennel seeds (if using).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spoon about 1/3 of the tomato sauce into the bottom of an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking dish.
Stuff each cooked shell with a heaping tablespoon of the tofu-cheese filling.
Arrange the stuffed shells in a single layer in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining sauce over the shells, covering them evenly.
Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese over the top.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Beef Brisket (Marinaded)
ingredients: 1/4 cup (2 oz) Soy sauce (low-sodium if preferred)
1 teaspoon Hot sauce (Louisiana-style (such as Tabasco or Crystal))
1 teaspoon Garlic powder (optional, for extra flavor)
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, hot sauce, garlic powder (if using), basil, brown sugar, and black pepper until the sugar dissolves.

Place the brisket in a large resealable plastic bag or a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Pour the marinade over the brisket, turning to coat all sides. Seal the bag or cover the dish tightly with plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for 24 hours, turning the brisket several times to ensure even marination.
When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 250°F (120°C).

Remove the brisket from the marinade and place it fat-side up in a roasting pan or Dutch oven. Pour any remaining marinade over the top. Cover the pan tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foil or a tight-fitting lid to seal in moisture.
Bake for 6 to 7 hours, until the brisket is fork-tender and the internal temperature reaches at least 190–200°F (88–93°C) for best tenderness.
Remove from the oven and let the brisket rest, covered, for 10–15 minutes before slicing.
Transfer the brisket to a cutting board. Slice thinly across the grain using a sharp knife or electric knife. Slicing against the grain ensures tender, easy-to-chew slices.
Serve hot with the pan juices spooned over the slices. Excellent with mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or in sandwiches.

recipes.name: Salmon Croquettes
ingredients: 15 ounces (1 can) Canned salmon (drained, bones and skin removed)
1/2 to 3/4 cup Soda crackers or saltines (finely crushed (about 12–15 crackers))
1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon Tabasco or hot sauce (or to taste)
2 to 3 tablespoons Vegetable oil or butter (for pan-frying)
instructions: Drain the canned salmon thoroughly. Place it in a mixing bowl and use a fork to flake it, removing any large bones and skin (though small soft bones are safe and add calcium).
Add the minced onion, beaten egg, Tabasco or hot sauce, black pepper, and lemon juice (if using). Mix gently to combine.

Stir in the crushed crackers, a little at a time, until the mixture holds together when pressed into a patty. It should be moist but not wet. If too dry, add a teaspoon of water or milk; if too wet, add more cracker crumbs.
Shape the mixture into 8 small patties, about 2 1/2 to 3 inches in diameter and about 1/2 inch thick. Place on a plate.
Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil or butter in a large skillet over medium heat until shimmering.

Carefully place the croquettes in the skillet, working in batches if necessary to avoid crowding. Cook for 3–4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Handle gently when flipping to keep them intact.
Transfer the cooked croquettes to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve hot with lemon wedges, tartar sauce, or a side of coleslaw and cornbread. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Macaroni, Ham, and Cheese
ingredients: 15 ounces (about 3 3/4 cups) Sharp cheddar cheese (shredded, reduced-fat if preferred)
about 1/2 cup total Milk (2% or whole)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 9x13x2-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Cook the macaroni according to package directions until al dente. Drain well and set aside.

If you have a meat grinder with a large-hole plate, grind the turkey ham and shredded cheese together. Run the 1/2 slice of bread through the grinder to collect any remaining cheese and ham. Mix well. If you don't have a grinder, finely chop or dice the ham and mix it with the shredded cheese and torn bread pieces.
In a small bowl, beat the egg (or large eggs) and add enough milk to make 1/2 cup total liquid. Mix well.
Begin layering in the prepared casserole: Start with a layer of the ham-cheese mixture, then a layer of cooked macaroni. Repeat, alternating layers, and end with a layer of ham and cheese on top.
Pour the egg-milk mixture evenly over the entire casserole.
Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden and the casserole is bubbly and heated through.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve hot with a green salad or steamed vegetables.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Roast
ingredients: 4 pounds Beef chuck roast or chicken pieces (trimmed of excess fat)
1 can (14 oz) Beef or chicken broth (low-sodium if preferred)
2 tablespoons Vinegar or lemon juice (white or apple cider vinegar)
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Brown the meat on all sides, working in batches if necessary. This should take about 8-10 minutes total. Remove the meat and set aside.
In the same pot, add the minced garlic and sliced onions. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and the onions begin to soften.
Return the browned meat to the pot. Add the broth, bay leaves, vinegar or lemon juice, and brown sugar. Stir to combine.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer gently for about 1 hour, or until the meat is tender. Check occasionally and add a little water if needed.
Stir in the tomato sauce and raisins. Continue simmering, covered, for another 30 minutes.
Remove the bay leaves before serving.
Serve hot over cooked long-grain white rice, with the sauce spooned over the top. Excellent with steamed vegetables on the side.

recipes.name: Scalloped Salmon
ingredients: 1 can (7 3/4 oz) Canned salmon (drained and flaked, bones removed)
2-3 tablespoons Soft bread crumbs (fresh, from about 1 slice bread)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Lightly coat 2 individual baking shells or ramekins (about 1-cup capacity each) with butter-flavored nonstick cooking spray.
In a small skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter or butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and green pepper. Sauté for 3-4 minutes, until tender but not browned.
In a medium bowl, combine the flaked salmon, evaporated milk, flour, salt, and black pepper (if using). Mix well.
Add the sautéed onion and pepper (along with any butter from the pan) to the salmon mixture. Stir to combine.
Divide the salmon mixture evenly between the prepared baking shells or ramekins.
In a small bowl, toss the soft bread crumbs with 1 teaspoon melted unsalted butter or butter. Sprinkle the buttered crumbs evenly over the tops of the salmon mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
Serve hot with a side of steamed vegetables, rice, or a green salad. Excellent with lemon wedges for squeezing over the top.

recipes.name: Chicken/Brown Rice Bake
ingredients: 3 cups Low-sodium chicken broth (fat skimmed off)
16 ounces (1 bag) Frozen mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn, green beans)
2 cups, chopped Cooked chicken or turkey (about 1 lb)
1 cup Additional chicken broth or water (recommended for better texture)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 12x8x2-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until crisp-tender.
Stir in the curry powder and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. This blooms the curry spices and enhances their flavor.
Add the 3 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.

Stir in the uncooked brown rice. Cover and continue to cook over low heat for 50-60 minutes, or until the liquid is mostly absorbed and the rice is tender. Check occasionally and add a bit more liquid if needed.
Once the rice is cooked, stir in the frozen mixed vegetables, chopped chicken (or turkey), and the additional 1 cup of broth or water. Mix well.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Cover tightly with foil and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until heated through and the vegetables are tender.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. This dish pairs well with a crisp salad and crusty bread.

recipes.name: Chicken Casserole
ingredients: 14 ounces (1 package) Seasoned bread stuffing mix
2 1/2 cups, diced Cooked chicken (about 1 lb cooked)
1/4 cup, chopped Green onions or fresh chives
2 cans (10.5 oz each) Condensed cream of mushroom soup (can use reduced-fat)
instructions: Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large bowl, combine the bread stuffing mix, melted unsalted butter, and 1/4 cup water. Toss until the stuffing is moistened.
Spread half of the stuffing mixture evenly in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
In another bowl, combine the diced chicken, chopped onion, green onions (or chives), celery, mayonnaise, and salt. Mix well.
Spread the chicken mixture evenly over the stuffing layer in the casserole dish.
Top with the remaining stuffing mixture, spreading it evenly.
In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Whisk in the milk until well combined.
Pour the egg-milk mixture evenly over the entire casserole, trying to moisten all areas.
Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil and refrigerate overnight (or for at least 4 hours).
When ready to bake, remove the casserole from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Spread the 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup evenly over the top of the casserole.
Bake uncovered for 1 hour, or until the casserole is hot and bubbly and the top is lightly browned.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. This is a perfect make-ahead dish for entertaining!

recipes.name: Chicken/Rice Casserole
ingredients: 8 pieces Chicken breasts (bone-in or boneless, or 1 whole fryer cut up)
1 can (10.5 oz) Condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 can (10.5 oz) Condensed cream of chicken or celery soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Coat a large 9x13-inch casserole dish or baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken (or celery) soup, and 2 soup cans of water until smooth.
Stir the uncooked rice into the soup mixture until well combined.
Pour the rice and soup mixture into the prepared casserole dish and spread evenly.
Dip each piece of chicken in the melted unsalted butter, coating both sides. Season the chicken with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange the chicken pieces on top of the rice mixture in a single layer.
Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake for about 2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F) and the rice is tender.
Remove the foil during the last 15-20 minutes of baking to allow the chicken to brown on top.
Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving. The rice will absorb the flavorful juices from the chicken and soup.

recipes.name: Jumbo Shells No. 1 (Spinach-Ricotta)
ingredients: 1 pound Fresh spinach (or 10 oz frozen chopped spinach, thawed)
1 large, beaten Egg (or 1/4 cup large eggs)
2/3 cup Ricotta cheese (part-skim or whole milk)
20 Jumbo pasta shells (cooked according to package directions)
3-4 cups Marinara or tomato sauce (homemade or jarred)
instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.

If using fresh spinach: In a large saucepan, combine the spinach with 2-3 tablespoons of water. Cover and simmer for 3-5 minutes until wilted. Drain well and squeeze out as much excess moisture as possible. Chop finely.
If using frozen spinach: Thaw completely and squeeze out all excess moisture. Chop if pieces are large.
In a small skillet, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook for 3-4 minutes, until tender but not browned.
Add the chopped spinach to the skillet and stir to combine. Heat through for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, combine the beaten egg, ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, nutmeg, and the spinach-onion mixture. Mix well.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spread half of the tomato sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Carefully stuff each cooked shell with about 2 tablespoons of the spinach-ricotta filling. Arrange the stuffed shells in the baking dish in a single layer.
Pour the remaining tomato sauce over the top of the shells, covering them evenly.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.

recipes.name: Jumbo Shells No. 2 (Meat Filling)
ingredients: 1 pound Ground beef or ground chicken (lean)
1 large, beaten Egg (or 1/4 cup large eggs)
20 Jumbo pasta shells (cooked according to package directions)
3-4 cups Marinara or tomato sauce (homemade or jarred)
instructions: Cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the ground beef (or chicken) and sauté, breaking it up with a spoon, until fully browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.
Drain any excess fat from the cooked meat and transfer it to a mixing bowl. Let cool slightly.
To the cooled meat, add the beaten egg, Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Mix well until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spread half of the tomato sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Carefully stuff each cooked shell with about 2 tablespoons of the meat filling. Arrange the stuffed shells in the baking dish in a single layer.
Pour the remaining tomato sauce over the top of the shells, covering them evenly.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. These can be served with a side salad and garlic bread for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Chili
ingredients: 1 pound Boneless chicken breast (cooked and diced)
1 pound Lean ground chuck (browned and drained)
2 cans (15 oz each) Kidney beans (drained and rinsed)
2 cans (14.5 oz each) Diced tomatoes (with juices)
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown the ground chuck over medium-high heat until fully cooked. Drain excess fat.
Add the diced cooked chicken to the pot.
Stir in the kidney beans, diced tomatoes (with their juices), and tomato sauce.
Add the diced onion, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder. Stir well to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer for 30-45 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Serve hot with cornbread, crackers, or over rice. Top with shredded cheese, sour cream, or chopped green onions if desired.
Note: A favorite of all the grandchildren: Becca, Drew, Alex, Hunter, and Chris.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Portotino (Serves One)
ingredients: 2-3 ounces Red snapper or halibut filets (cut into small strips)
1/2 cup Fresh mussels (cleaned; if not available, increase fish to 4-5 oz)
2 ounces dry (1 oz cooked) Spaghetti (about 1 cup cooked)
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions; drain and set aside.
In a medium skillet, warm the minced garlic in oil and butter over medium heat.
Add the fish strips and sauté for about 1 minute until they start to turn opaque.
Carefully add the brandy and ignite with a long match or lighter. Let the flames burn out naturally (about 30 seconds).
Add the mussels, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, oregano, and Tabasco. Stir gently.
Stir in the chunky tomato sauce, catsup, parsley, and white wine. Bring to a simmer.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the sauce and toss to combine.
Simmer for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.
Serve immediately with a green salad and warm French bread.
Note: Original recipe brought from Cozumel, Mexico by Ed & Mary Carle.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Portotino (Serves Six)
ingredients: 8 large cloves Fresh garlic, minced (about 3 tablespoons)
1 1/2 pounds Red snapper or halibut filets (cut into small strips)
1/2 cup Brandy (such as Napoleon or other quality brandy)
2 tablespoons Fresh basil, chopped (or 2 teaspoons dried)
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions; drain and set aside.
In a large wok or deep skillet, warm the minced garlic in olive oil and melted unsalted butter over medium heat.
Add the fish strips and sauté for about 3 minutes until they start to turn opaque and are nearly cooked through.
Carefully add the brandy. If desired, you can ignite it with a long match for dramatic presentation. Let flames burn out naturally.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, fresh basil, and Tabasco. Stir gently to combine.
Stir in the chunky tomato sauce, catsup, parsley, and white wine.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the wok and toss everything together.
Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes until everything is heated through and well combined.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Serve immediately in large pasta bowls with a green salad and warm French bread.
Note: Original recipe brought from Cozumel, Mexico by Ed & Mary Carle.

recipes.name: Royal Rice
ingredients: 3 cups, lightly packed Cooked long-grain rice (cooked in chicken or beef broth)
1/2 cup, finely chopped Green onions (including tops)
1 can (4 ounces), drained Sliced mushrooms, canned
1/4 teaspoon, or to taste Black pepper
instructions: Prepare the rice ahead of time in chicken or beef broth so it is cooked, fluffy, and still warm or at room temperature.
In a large skillet, melt the unsalted butter or butter over medium heat.
Add the chopped green onions and saute 3–4 minutes until tender but not browned.
Stir in the drained mushrooms and cook 1–2 minutes more.
Add the cooked rice, breaking up any clumps with a fork or spatula. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper.
Toss gently over medium heat until the rice is hot throughout and evenly coated with the butter and vegetables.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt or pepper, if needed.
Fluff with a fork and serve hot as a side dish with roasted or grilled meats or fish.

recipes.name: Hush Puppies
ingredients: 1 cup, leveled Fine or medium-grain cornmeal
As needed for deep or shallow frying Oil or fat for frying
instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a full boil over medium-high heat.
If using onion and/or garlic, stir them into the boiling water and cook 1 minute to soften.
Reduce heat to low. While stirring constantly with a wooden spoon or whisk, slowly pour in the cornmeal in a thin stream to avoid lumps.
Cook, stirring continuously, until the mixture is thick and pulls away from the sides of the pan, 2–4 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in the salt, then add the egg and mix quickly until fully incorporated and the batter is smooth and thick.
Let the mixture stand until it is cool enough to handle and firm enough to shape, about 15–20 minutes.
With slightly damp hands, scoop about 1 tablespoon of dough at a time and roll into short logs or small balls, about finger size. Set formed hush puppies on a parchment-lined tray.
Heat frying oil or reserved fish-frying fat in a deep pot or skillet to 350–365°F (175–185°C).
Fry the hush puppies in batches without crowding, turning occasionally, until deep golden brown and crisp on the outside, 3–4 minutes.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle lightly with extra salt while hot, if desired.
Serve warm alongside fried fish or other seafood.

recipes.name: Broccoli and Rice
ingredients: 1 jar (8 oz) or 1 cup Processed cheese sauce (such as Cheese Whiz)
1 can (10.5 oz) Cream of chicken soup
3 cups Cooked long-grain white rice (from 1 cup uncooked)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large skillet, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add the frozen broccoli to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the broccoli is tender and heated through, about 5–7 minutes.
Stir in the cheese sauce and cream of chicken soup, mixing until the cheese is fully melted and the mixture is smooth.
Add the cooked rice and stir until everything is well combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Bake for 20–30 minutes, or until the casserole is hot throughout and bubbling around the edges.
Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve as a side dish with chicken, pork, or beef.

recipes.name: Banana Nut Bread
ingredients: 2 large eggs (or 1/2 cup substitute) Eggs or large eggs
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Coat a 9×5-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray or line with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and softened unsalted butter until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs (or large eggs) until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and cloves.
Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture and stir until just combined (do not overmix).
Fold in the mashed bananas and chopped nuts until evenly distributed.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 60–70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.

recipes.name: Cranberry Bread
ingredients: about 1/2 cup Fresh orange juice (from 1 large orange)
about 2 tablespoons Grated orange rind (from 1 large orange)
as needed to make 3/4 cup total liquid Water
2 cups, halved Fresh or frozen cranberries
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan or coat with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl or measuring cup, combine the fresh orange juice and grated rind, then add enough water to make 3/4 cup total liquid. Stir in the beaten egg and oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until moistened and combined. The batter will be slightly lumpy.
Gently fold in the halved cranberries and chopped nuts, distributing them evenly.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 50–60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
For best flavor and easier slicing, wrap and refrigerate overnight before serving.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Generously grease three 1-pound coffee cans or three 8x4-inch loaf pans, or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the sifted flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar.
In a separate bowl, combine the beaten eggs, water, vegetable oil, and pumpkin puree. Whisk until smooth and well blended.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Do not overmix.
Fold in the chopped pecans, distributing them evenly throughout the batter.
Divide the batter evenly among the three prepared cans or loaf pans, filling each about two-thirds full.
Bake for 60–70 minutes, or until a toothpick or skewer inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the loaves cool in the cans or pans for 10–15 minutes, then carefully turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Wrap the cooled loaves in plastic wrap or foil and let rest overnight for easier slicing and richer flavor.

recipes.name: Waffles
instructions: Preheat your waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar (if using).
Separate the eggs, placing the whites in a clean bowl and the yolks in another.
Beat the egg yolks lightly, then whisk in the milk and vegetable oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Some lumps are okay.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the batter using a rubber spatula. Do not overmix.
Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron (amount will vary by waffle maker size).
Cook until the waffles are golden brown and crisp, usually 3-5 minutes depending on your waffle iron.
Serve immediately with butter, syrup, fresh fruit, or your favorite toppings.

recipes.name: Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour with the yeast and mix well.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk, water, 1/2 cup sugar, oil, and salt over low heat until warm (120-130°F), stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Pour the warm liquid into the flour-yeast mixture. Beat with an electric mixer for 2-3 minutes until smooth.
Beat in the egg whites until incorporated.
Add 1 more cup of flour and beat for 1 minute.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour to make a dough that is too stiff to stir.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes, adding flour as needed, until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place (80-85°F) until doubled, about 1 1/2-2 hours.
Punch down the dough and let rest for 10 minutes.
Roll the dough into a large rectangle, about 1/2-inch thick.
Brush the dough generously with melted unsalted butter or butter.
Mix the brown sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle evenly over the buttered dough.
Starting from a long edge, roll the dough tightly into a log. Cut into 1-inch slices.
Place the rolls in greased 9x13-inch pans, leaving space between them. Spray the tops lightly with cooking spray.
Cover and let rise until doubled, 30-45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
While the rolls bake, make the glaze by whisking together confectioners' sugar and enough milk to make a drizzling consistency.
Drizzle the glaze over warm rolls and serve.

recipes.name: Cornmeal Yeast Rolls
instructions: In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk, sugar, oil, unsalted butter, and salt over low heat until the unsalted butter melts. Stir well and cool to 105-115°F.
Add the cooled milk mixture to the yeast mixture.
Stir in the large eggs, cornmeal, and 2 cups of the flour.
Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour to form a soft dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 8 minutes, adding flour as needed, until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning to coat all sides. Cover and let rise in a warm place (about 85°F) until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough and divide into 36 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a smooth ball.
Place the balls on greased or parchment-lined baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Cover and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes, or until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the rolls are golden brown.
Brush the hot rolls lightly with melted butter or spray with butter-flavored cooking spray.
Remove from the pans immediately and serve warm.

recipes.name: Basic Sweet Dough
ingredients: 4 1/2 to 5 cups, sifted All purpose flour (divided)
1/3 cup Vegetable oil (plus extra for brushing)
4 large Egg whites (or 1/2 cup liquid egg whites)
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of the flour with the yeast. Whisk together to distribute the yeast evenly.

In a small saucepan, combine the milk, water, sugar, 1/3 cup oil, and salt. Warm over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture reaches 120–130°F and the sugar dissolves. It should feel warm but not hot to the touch.

Pour the warm liquid into the flour-yeast mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping the bowl frequently, then beat on high speed for 2–3 minutes until smooth. (Or beat vigorously by hand for about 300 strokes.)
Add the egg whites and beat until incorporated.
Mix in 1 more cup of flour and beat for 1 minute.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour (about 1 1/2 to 2 cups) to make a dough that is too stiff to stir.

Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 8–10 minutes, adding small amounts of flour as needed, until the dough is smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky. Proper kneading develops the gluten and creates a light, airy texture.
Shape the dough into a ball. Place it in a large bowl lightly coated with nonstick spray or oil. Turn the dough once to coat the surface. Cover with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap.

Let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place (80–85°F) until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours. To test, gently press two fingers into the dough; if the indentation remains, the dough is ready.
Punch down the dough to release the air. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
Shape the dough as desired: rolls, buns, cinnamon rolls, coffee cakes, or loaves. Place shaped dough into pans coated with nonstick spray. Lightly brush the tops with oil to prevent drying.
Cover and let rise again in a warm place until nearly doubled in size, 30–45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake for 20–25 minutes (rolls and buns) or 30–35 minutes (loaves), until golden brown. The bread should sound hollow when tapped on the bottom.
Remove from pans and let cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Dinner Rolls
ingredients: 3 to 3 1/2 cups Bread flour or all-purpose flour (sifted, divided)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine about 1 cup of the flour with the yeast. Whisk together to distribute the yeast evenly.

In a small saucepan, combine the milk, oil, sugar, and salt. Heat over low heat, stirring occasionally, until warm to the touch (110-115°F) and the sugar and salt dissolve. The mixture should feel warm but not hot.
Pour the warm liquid into the flour-yeast mixture. Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes, or beat vigorously by hand for about 300 strokes, until smooth.
Add 1/2 to 1 cup more flour and beat for an additional 1 minute.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour (about 1 1/2 to 2 cups) to form a soft dough that pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead for 8-10 minutes, adding small amounts of flour as needed, until the dough is smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky.
Lightly coat a large bowl with nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl and turn once to coat. Cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
Let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place (80-85°F) until doubled in size, about 1 hour. To test, gently press two fingers into the dough; if the indentation remains, it's ready.
Punch down the dough to release the air. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and shape into desired forms: round rolls, cloverleaf, Parker House, crescents, etc.
Place shaped rolls on lightly greased baking sheets or in muffin tins, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Cover and let rise again until nearly doubled, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the rolls are golden brown on top.
Serve piping hot with butter. Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 3 days, or freeze for up to 1 month.

recipes.name: Crumble Coffee Cake #2
ingredients: 1 full batch Basic Sweet Dough (prepared to thick batter consistency (see Basic Sweet Dough recipe))
instructions: Prepare one full batch of Basic Sweet Dough according to the recipe, but add a bit more liquid so the dough reaches a thick cake batter consistency rather than a standard bread dough texture.
Coat 4 to 5 eight-inch square baking pans with nonstick cooking spray.
Divide the dough evenly among the pans. Spread to about 3/8-inch thickness (it will rise during proofing). The dough should cover the bottom of each pan.
Prepare the crumble topping: In a medium bowl, combine the sugar, vanilla, eggs (or large eggs), softened unsalted butter, and baking powder. Mix until well blended.
Gradually work in the flour, mixing and rubbing the mixture between your fingers until crumbles form. The crumbles should vary in size, with the largest about the size of a blueberry.
Sprinkle the crumble topping evenly over each unbaked coffee cake, distributing it as uniformly as possible.
Cover the pans lightly and let the cakes rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until noticeably puffy.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cakes are golden brown and the crumble topping is lightly crisped.
Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then cut into squares and serve warm or at room temperature. Excellent with coffee or tea!

recipes.name: Stöllen
ingredients: 1 cup Granulated sugar (plus extra for topping)
3/4 to 1 pound Candied fruit mix and/or Muscat raisins (seeded raisins)
from 1 lemon Fresh lemon zest (finely grated)
instructions: Scald the milk and let it cool to lukewarm (110°F). In a medium bowl, combine 1 cup of the flour, the lukewarm milk, and the yeast. Mix well, cover, and set in a warm place to rise until light and bubbly, about 30-45 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine the candied fruit, raisins, and grated lemon zest in a bowl. Pour the rosewater and rum over the fruit mixture. Cover and set aside to macerate.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened unsalted butter (reserving 3 tablespoons) and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

In a very large bowl or on a clean work surface, place the remaining 7 cups of flour and the salt. Make a well in the center. Add the creamed unsalted butter mixture, the yeast sponge, and the fruit mixture (including any liquid). Mix well by hand, working the ingredients together and adding a bit more flour if the dough is too sticky.

Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 8-10 minutes, until smooth and not too sticky. Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
Punch down the dough and divide it into 6 equal portions. Shape each portion into a round lump, then flatten slightly into an oval.

Melt the reserved 3 tablespoons of unsalted butter. Brush each oval with melted unsalted butter, then sprinkle with sugar and chopped almonds. Fold each oval in half lengthwise and place in a greased baking pan.
Brush the tops with additional melted unsalted butter. Cover and let rise in a warm place until puffy, about 45-60 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Bake for 40-60 minutes, or until golden brown and the bread sounds hollow when tapped. If the tops brown too quickly, tent with foil.
Cool on wire racks. Dust with powdered sugar before serving if desired. Stöllen keeps well and improves with age when wrapped tightly.

recipes.name: Stöllen (Kanis Recipe)
ingredients: 1 1/2 to 4 pounds Granulated sugar (use 1 1/2 lbs for less sweet version)
about 2 pounds total Mixed candied fruit (cherries, citron, lemon peel, orange peel, pineapple) (chopped)
1/2 cup Whiskey or brandy (for macerating fruit)
1 pound (4 sticks) Butter (plus extra for brushing)
7 to 12 pounds All-purpose flour (use enough for stiff dough)
from 2 lemons Fresh lemon zest (finely grated)
instructions: The night before: In a large bowl, combine all the candied fruit, raisins (if using), and sugar. Pour 1/2 cup whiskey over the mixture, stir well, cover, and let macerate overnight.
The next morning: Add the chopped almonds and pecans to the fruit mixture.
In a very large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, eggs, salt, and remaining sugar until well combined.
Warm the milk to lukewarm (110°F) and dissolve the yeast in it. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy.
Add the yeast mixture, the fruit-nut mixture, lemon zest, rosewater, and almond extract to the creamed butter mixture. Mix well.
Gradually add flour, starting with about 7 pounds, mixing and kneading until you have a stiff dough that is smooth but not sticky. Add more flour as needed, up to 12 pounds total.
Cover the dough and let it rise slowly in a cool place for a long time—overnight is ideal. The slow rise develops flavor.
The next day, turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Handle gently. Roll or pat out lightly to about 1 inch thickness.
Cut the dough into portions of about 1 1/2 pounds each. Shape each portion into a loaf by folding and tucking the edges under.
Place the loaves on greased baking sheets. Cover and let rise again until puffy, about 1-2 hours.
Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Bake for about 1 hour, or until golden brown and the loaves sound hollow when tapped.
While still hot, brush the tops with melted butter or unsalted butter. Mix some powdered sugar with almond extract and rub this almond-flavored sugar on top of each loaf.
Cool completely before slicing. Stöllen improves with age and can be stored for weeks when wrapped tightly.

recipes.name: Dinner Roll Shapes
ingredients: 1 batch Prepared dinner roll dough (from Basic Sweet Dough or Dinner Rolls recipe)
instructions: Prepare your favorite dinner roll dough recipe and let it rise until doubled.
Punch down the dough and divide as needed for the shapes you wish to make.

FOR CLOVERLEAF ROLLS: Pinch off small pieces of dough and roll into balls about 1/2 inch in diameter. Lightly spray muffin cups with nonstick spray. Place 3 balls in each muffin cup to form a cloverleaf shape. Let rise until doubled, then bake at 375°F (190°C) for 12-15 minutes until golden.

FOR CRESCENT ROLLS: Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut into 6-inch circles, then cut each circle into 6 wedges (or roll into a 3-inch-wide rectangle and cut into triangles). Brush with melted unsalted butter. Starting at the wide end, roll up each triangle and curve into a crescent shape. Place on greased baking sheet, let rise until doubled, then bake at 375°F (190°C) for 12-15 minutes.

FOR PARKERHOUSE ROLLS: Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut with a 3-inch biscuit cutter. Use a spoon handle to make a crease just below center of each circle. Brush with unsalted butter. Fold the top half over the bottom half (bottom should be slightly larger). Place on greased baking sheet, let rise until doubled, then bake at 375°F (190°C) for 12-15 minutes.

FOR FANTAN ROLLS: Roll dough into a rectangle 1/8-inch thick. Cut into 1-inch-wide strips. Brush with melted unsalted butter. Stack 6-7 strips on top of each other. Cut the stack into 1 1/4-inch pieces. Place each piece cut-side up in greased muffin cups. Let rise until doubled, then bake at 375°F (190°C) for 12-15 minutes.
All shapes should be golden brown when done. Brush with additional butter if desired while still warm.

recipes.name: Corn Bread - Southern Style (Restored)
ingredients: 1/3 cup (80ml) Melted butter or bacon drippings
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place 1 tablespoon of butter or bacon drippings in a 9-inch square cast iron skillet or baking pan and place in the oven to heat.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, beaten eggs, and melted butter (or remaining bacon drippings).
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir with a wooden spoon just until moistened. Do not overmix.
Carefully remove the hot skillet from the oven. Swirl to coat the bottom with the melted fat.
Pour the batter into the hot skillet (it should sizzle).
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Serve warm with butter.
notes: Restored to original family version using whole ingredients and metric measurements.

recipes.name: Corn Bread - Southern Style With Buttermilk (Variation)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease an 8-inch square baking pan or coat with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, egg, and vegetable oil until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Do not overmix; some small lumps are okay.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 20-22 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
Serve warm with butter or as a side to soups, chilis, and stews.
Note: This recipe was revised on December 24, 1995 for improved texture and flavor.

recipes.name: Dinner Roll Shapes
ingredients: 3 to 3 1/2 cups All-purpose flour (plus more for kneading)
instructions: In a large bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water. Let stand 5 minutes until foamy.
Add the sugar, salt, softened unsalted butter, egg, and 2 cups of the flour to the yeast mixture. Beat with a mixer or wooden spoon until smooth.
Gradually stir in enough of the remaining flour (1 to 1 1/2 cups) to make a soft dough that pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning once to coat all sides. Cover with a clean towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough to release air bubbles. At this point, you can shape the rolls in various forms:
FOR CLOVERLEAF ROLLS: Pinch off dough and form into small balls about 1/2 inch in diameter. Place 3 balls in each greased muffin cup.

FOR CRESCENT ROLLS: Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness and cut into 6-inch circles. Cut each circle into 6-8 wedges. Brush with melted unsalted butter. Starting at the wide end, roll up each wedge and curve into a crescent shape. Place on greased baking sheet.

FOR PARKERHOUSE ROLLS: Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut with a 3-inch biscuit cutter. Make a crease just below the center of each circle with a knife handle or spoon. Brush with melted unsalted butter. Fold the top half over the bottom half (bottom should be slightly larger). Place on greased baking sheet.

FOR FANTAN ROLLS: Roll dough into a rectangle about 1/8-inch thick. Cut into 1-inch-wide strips. Brush with melted unsalted butter. Stack 6-7 strips on top of each other. Cut the stack into 1 1/4-inch pieces. Place each piece cut-side up in a greased muffin cup.
Cover shaped rolls and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown.
Brush with additional melted butter if desired. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Fluffy Buttermilk Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C). Lightly coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine the vegetable oil, buttermilk, and butter flavoring (if using). Do not stir—just combine them gently.
Pour the liquid mixture all at once into the dry ingredients.
Stir quickly with a fork just until the mixture clings together and forms a shaggy ball. Do not overmix.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured board or clean work surface.
Using just your fingertips (not your palms), gently knead the dough 10-12 times until it just comes together.
Pat or roll the dough out to 1/2 to 1 inch thickness.
Cut biscuits with a floured 2-inch biscuit cutter, pressing straight down without twisting.
Place the biscuits on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown.
Serve hot with butter, jam, or honey.

recipes.name: Pizza Dough (Crusty)
recipes.servings: Dough for two 12-inch pizzas or one large sheet pizza
ingredients: 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 cups All-purpose flour (start with 2 1/2 cups)
instructions: In a large warmed mixing bowl, sprinkle the yeast over the warm water. Let stand for 5 minutes until the yeast is foamy.
Stir in the salt, olive oil, and 2 1/2 cups of the flour. Mix with a wooden spoon or a stand mixer with a dough hook for about 2 minutes.
Gradually add more flour, 1/2 cup at a time, mixing or kneading until the dough clings together, pulls away from the sides of the bowl, and is no longer sticky.
Knead the dough for 5 minutes (by hand on a floured surface or with a dough hook) until smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a bowl coated with nonstick spray or lightly oiled. Turn the dough to coat all sides.
Cover the bowl with a damp towel or plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place (about 80°F) until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Punch down the dough to release air bubbles.
Divide the dough in half for two round pizzas, or leave whole for one large sheet pizza.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out each portion into the desired shape and thickness.
Transfer to a pizza pan or baking sheet sprinkled with cornmeal.
Top with your favorite pizza toppings.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 18-22 minutes, or until the crust is golden and crispy and the cheese is bubbly.

recipes.name: Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can (14-15 oz) Green beans (drained and rinsed)
1 can (14-15 oz) Kidney beans or lima beans (drained and rinsed)
1 large (or 1 jar pimento) Red bell pepper or pimento (diced)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the drained green beans, corn, kidney beans, diced celery, chopped onion, and diced peppers.
In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar, water, and oil. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Pour the hot marinade over the vegetables and toss gently to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, stirring occasionally.
Serve chilled as a side salad or on a bed of lettuce.

recipes.name: Blueberry Jello Salad
ingredients: 6 oz box Red raspberry gelatin, family size
3 oz box Red raspberry gelatin, regular size
instructions: FIRST LAYER: In a large bowl, dissolve the 6-oz family-size raspberry gelatin in 3 1/2 cups boiling water, stirring until completely dissolved. Pour into a 9x13-inch loaf pan or dish and refrigerate until very firm, about 2–3 hours.

SECOND LAYER: In a small bowl, sprinkle the unflavored gelatin over 1/2 cup cold water and let stand 5 minutes to soften. In a small saucepan, heat the milk and sugar over medium-low heat, stirring, until the sugar dissolves. Do not boil. Add the softened unflavored gelatin and stir until fully dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Let cool slightly, then whisk in the softened cream cheese until smooth. Stir in the chopped pecans. Let the mixture cool to lukewarm, then gently pour over the firm first layer. Refrigerate until set, about 1–2 hours.

THIRD LAYER: Dissolve the 3-oz regular-size raspberry gelatin in 1 cup boiling water, stirring well. Gently stir in the blueberries and their juice. Let cool to room temperature, then carefully pour over the second layer. Refrigerate until very firm, at least 2–3 hours or overnight.
To serve, cut into squares and serve on lettuce leaves if desired. The three distinct layers create a beautiful presentation.

recipes.name: Oriental Salad
ingredients: 3 bags (10 oz each) Cole slaw mix (about 30 oz total)
2 packages (3 oz each) Oriental-flavor Ramen noodles (reserve seasoning packets)
2 (from the noodle packages) Ramen seasoning packets
instructions: In a small skillet, toast the sliced almonds and sesame seeds in the sesame oil over medium heat, stirring frequently, until golden and fragrant, about 3–5 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Break the uncooked Ramen noodles into small pieces (discard the seasoning packets for now, or save for the dressing).
In a large salad bowl, combine the cole slaw mix, chopped green onions, broken Ramen noodles, toasted almonds, and toasted sesame seeds. Toss to mix.

In a jar or small bowl, combine the safflower or canola oil, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, and the two Ramen seasoning packets. Shake or whisk vigorously until well blended and the sugar is dissolved.
Just before serving, pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to coat evenly.
Serve immediately for maximum crunch. If making ahead, keep the dressing separate and toss just before serving to prevent the noodles from becoming soggy.

recipes.name: Raspberry Jello Salad
ingredients: 6 oz box Red raspberry gelatin, family size
15 oz can with juice Blueberries (or 2 cups fresh, frozen and cooked)
1 can (15-20 oz) with juice Pineapple tidbits
instructions: Drain the blueberries and pineapple, reserving the juices. Measure the combined juices and add enough boiling water to make 2 cups total liquid.
In a large bowl, dissolve the raspberry gelatin in the 2 cups of hot juice-water mixture, stirring until completely dissolved.
Stir in the drained blueberries and pineapple tidbits. Pour into a 9x13-inch dish and refrigerate until firm, about 3–4 hours.
In a medium bowl, beat together the sour cream, softened cream cheese, and sugar until smooth and creamy.
Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the top of the chilled gelatin layer.
Sprinkle the chopped nuts over the creamy topping.
